page.title: 01HOCKWOLD-CUM-WILTON
page.content: This block covers a rural area, the majority of which is arable farm-land. It rises from a river valley 1/2 mile away, to not more than 50 ft. above sea level. To the south is the village of Hockwold-cum-Wilton with a population of approx. 1000, living in about 410 houses. On the Western boundary is a B class road, much used by American Servicemen commuting between Feltwell and Lakenheath Air- bases. To the East is an area of coniferous forest, owned and supervised by the Forestry Commission, a Government sponsored body. The farm- land is mainly owner occupied in units of 50-300 acres. The majority of houses are also owner occupied, though there are 62 owned by the Borough Council.On most days there is frequent air activity by USA planes.
